main event: Sergeant Frank Boll and Sergeant Vincent Coppola observed an unusually bright light in the sky that changed colors occasionally to blue, green, and red, appearing and disappearing periodically.
interesting points: The object was approximately 3-4 times the size of a star.
The object was observed through binoculars.
The sighting occurred in Trenton, New Jersey on May 6, 1958.
sighted object: unusually bright light in the sky
witnesses: Sergeant Frank Boll and Sergeant Vincent Coppola
